results.title: 1900: Age of hope. 1914: Killing fields. 1917: Red flag
results.creator_credit: Bill Treharne Jones, Jonathan Lewis, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “People’s century: 1900-1999”.
This tape contains the first three episodes of the ‘People’s century 1900-1999’ series. “1900: age of hope”; as the century begins, a trade exhibition in Paris captures the optimism of the new century as the powerful countries of the world showcase their material progress. The state funeral of Queen Victoria in 1901 undermines progress however, reminding the country of its ties with the old order of European dynasties. Russia too is caught firmly in the grip of autocracy, leading many Europeans to migrate to America. Mass literacy vastly changes the political awareness of ordinary citizens and newspapers bring politics to the masses in Britain and the United States. The suffragette movement is also in full swing, while the colonies work towards self government. Europe is caught up in strategic alliances, a situation which ensures world involvement should a war begin. Narrated by Sean Barrett. “1914: killing fields”; Europe and Germany are drawn into a new kind of war - an industrialized war in which logistics and machine guns make a devastating and significant debut. There is the first full scale project of propaganda against the Germans, as battles at the Somme, Verdun and Ypres facilitate the slaughter of thousands of soldiers on both sides of the battle. The war ends in 1918 with an armistice and no clear victor, as well as a new distrust of public figureheads who allowed the slaughter to continue. It seems doubtful the world can return to the idyll of 1914. Narrated by Veronica Hyks. “917: red flag”; in the Soviet Union the people finally make a move to overthrown the tsar, Nicholas II, and put an end to autocratic power. An uprising, led by the Marxist socialist Lenin succeeds in overthrowing the tsar and his family. He replaces it with another system which would have international repercussion, Communism, which appealed to America during the Depression due to its productivity and opportunities for women. Narrated by Sean Barrett.

results.title: Pele: the master and his method
results.brief_description: Depicts ball passing mehods, including wall pass, short chip, instep drive etc. Emphasizes role of the receiver and importance of thinking and the use of shouting.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Physical preparation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pele: the master and his method”.
Stresses the importance of physical fitness in enabling players to give their best. Shows warm-up exercises and describes in detail the circuit training methods, used by the Brazilian team in which players move from station to station performing different exercises in sequence.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Trapping and heading
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Pele: the master and his method”
Demonstrates trapping skills with cushioning, inside and outside-of-the-foot traps, sole and instep traps and trapping on the run. Also shows a variety of heading techniques including how to play heading tennis.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Shooting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pele: the master and his method”.
Pele demonstrates kicks used in shooting, which must be mastered with both feet. Depicts instep drive, shooting on the run, front volley, curved shot and bicycle kick.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Ball juggling and dribbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pele: the master and his method”.
Briefly covers the career of Pele in an overview of the soccer skills that led to Brazil’s success in the World Cup competition. Describes the skills involved with ball juggling and dribbling, showing each in slow motion and in the context of an actual game in stop-motion. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Peach's gold
results.brief_description: Bill Peach describes how the discovery of gold changed the course of Australia’s history. Through dramatised re-enactments and historical footage, the effects of the new economic force on population, the location of towns, wealth generation, the development of transport networks and the introduction of a representative democracy are all investigated. In this series Bill Peach traces the story of gold from its earliest discovery to the early 1980s.

In this series Bill Peach traces the story of gold from its earliest discovery to the early 1980s.

results.title: Life on the goldfields
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Peach’s gold”.
Bill Peach presents a look at life on the goldfields after the Eureka stockade. It was a colourful but often violent time, where fortunes were made and lost in a heartbeat. Using dramatised re-enactments as well as historical footage, the point is made that not all of those who came to the goldfields were fortunate enough to realise their dream, however they almost always embodied the pioneer spirit. Out of this free-wheeling era emerged the beginnings of a new society.

results.title: Land of gold
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Peach’s gold”.
Using dramatised re-enactments as well as historical footage, Bill Peach investigates the economic crash of the 1890s and the exhaustion of the goldfields at Ballarat and Bendigo. He describes how the less well known but far more productive goldfields at Coolgardie and Kalgoorlie rescued Australia from the depths of depression and continued to contribute to the country’s economy up to the early 1980s.
